instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-00923: What is 820-00923? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.CD3215: What is CD3215? This is a USB-C muxing chip responsible for USB-C communication with devices such as the laptop charger. The most common issue this chip is involved in is when a Macbook wonâ€™t charge or the charger is stuck at 5v instead of going to 20v..

threads.title: USB-C USING TOO MUCH POWER (<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00923</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>)
threads.message: GOOD DAY GUYS: I HAVE MACBOOK PRO 13-INCH TOUCH, WHEN I CONNECT A USB DEVICE ON THE RIGHT-HAND SIDE, I GET THE ERROR MESSAGE ::: unplug the accessory using too much power to re-enable usb devices::: I HAVE REPLACED THE CHARGING PORT BUT NO DIFFERENCE, THIS IS MY FIRST TIME WITH SUCH ISSUE, I DO NOT QUITE KNOW WHERE TO BEGIN, PLEASE HELP.

threads.title: USB-C USING TOO MUCH POWER (<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00923</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>)
threads.message:
The charger works on the mentioned ports?
Any fault history available?

Which <CHIP>CD3215</CHIP> chips correspond to this issue?
Compare diode mode readings between L3500 and LB700.

threads.title: USB-C USING TOO MUCH POWER (<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00923</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>)
threads.message:
Thank you for your swift response,
This is the right side of the ports, and the charger works, just USB DEVICES do not work
The corresponding <CHIP>CD3215</CHIP> are UB300 & UB400
 LB700 is lower than L3500 in diode mode
LB700=0.289
L3500=0.310

threads.title: USB-C USING TOO MUCH POWER (<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00923</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>)
threads.message:
I replaced QB701 and DIODE MODE reading  compared to a known good board is now okay, however, 
I still get the same error message, USB DEVICES only work on the left, not the right ports, error message still persists

threads.title: USB-C USING TOO MUCH POWER (<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00923</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>)
threads.message:
Do you get LB700 voltage, when connect an USB device on right side?
Be sure RB701/6 are good.

threads.title: USB-C USING TOO MUCH POWER (<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00923</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>)
threads.message: Yes, I do get 5V when I connect a USB device to the right. also, I get 5V output on RB701/6. I even replace UB700, but no difference.

threads.title: USB-C USING TOO MUCH POWER (<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00923</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>)
threads.message:
No need to change UB700, if got correct voltage on LB700.

Check <RESISTOR>R0552</RESISTOR>/3.
Also compare their pin 2 voltage with <RESISTOR>R0550</RESISTOR>/1, when connect an USB device on corresponding port.
